cards.title: Angolan civil war
cards.description: Roll a die and subtract (-1) from the die roll for every country adjacent to Angola (including itself) edged by other players. On a modified die roll of 3-6, gain 1 VP, remove 1 influence from each other player in Angola and then add enough influence to edge Angola.

cards.title: Anti-globalization movement
cards.description: Put this card in play. Economy cards played during this round have -1 ops. Discard this card when the current round ends

cards.title: Black Monday
cards.description: US and EU lose supremacy on all NWO economy slots.

cards.title: Boris Yeltsin
cards.description: US gains 1 influence in Russia.

cards.title: Chechen wars
cards.description: If played by Russia, it gains enough influence to get the edge in Caucasus states and lose 1VP. Otherwise, remove influence from Russia from Caucasus states until Russia loses the edge.

cards.title: Congo wars
cards.description: Roll a die and subtract (-1) from the die roll for every country adjacent to Congo edged by another country. On a modified die roll of 3-6, remove 1 influence from each other player in Congo and then add enough influence to edge Congo.

cards.title: Democracy in Nigeria
cards.description: Gain 1VP. Put this card in play. Nigeria now has a stability of 2. Gain 1 influence in Nigeria.

cards.title: Economic crisis
cards.description: If first epoch, remove 1 influence on a country having East influence, and place 1 West influence on it. If second epoch, remove 1 influence on a country having West influence, and place 1 East influence on it.

cards.title: EFTA agreement
cards.description: EU gains 1 influence in Norway. Put this card in play. Norway is considered an oil production country. Remove this card from play at the beginning of turn 6.

cards.title: El Jefe
cards.description: Put this card in play. US cannot use influence ops in Cuba. China and Russia gain 1 influence in Cuba.

cards.title: Embassy asylum
cards.description: Choose a personality card in the discard pile. Play it for its text.

cards.title: Empire of war
cards.description: If you are the US player, make a coup with this ops value on a conflictive country. If succesful, make a second coup with the same ops value on a non-conflictive country.

cards.title: Europe
cards.description: 2/2/3, +1VP per conflictive country, Each player loses 1VP for each country in the region which is edged by another player and is adjacent to or it is one of the player’s superpower countries.

cards.title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
cards.description: Remove 1 Russian influence on Germany, add 1 West influence on Germany. US gains 1VP. US gains 1 additional VP if this card is played by an East Player. US gains 1 additional VP if this card is played on turns 1-4

cards.title: FSB creation
cards.description: Russia gains 1 influence in Russia. Put this card in play. As a Personality is played by its text, you can remove this card from the game to cancel the text.

cards.title: G20
cards.description: Put this card in play. All your ops are at +1 this round. If playing a game with 4 players, your first played op has an additional +1 this turn. Discard this card at the end of the round

cards.title: IMF intervention
cards.description: You can look at another player's hand and play one of her cards by its text.

cards.title: Immigrants
cards.description: Add 1 East influence on US, Canada, or an EU country. The player with the edge on the country (if any) can negate this effect by losing 2VP.

cards.title: Israeli-Palestinian wars
cards.description: Roll a die and substract 1 from the die roll for Israel and every country adjacent to Israel which is not edged by the US. On a modified die roll of 1 or less, all players except US receive 1 VP, then remove 1 US influence in Israel and in a country adjacent to Israel.

cards.title: Katrina
cards.description: US loses 1VP.

cards.title: Khobar towers attack
cards.description: Remove 1 West influence of Saudi Arabia.

cards.title: Maastrich Treaty
cards.description: Add 1 EU influence in up to 2 of these countries: Germany, France, Italy, Spain-Portugal, Benelux, Denmark, Greece. EU gains 1VP.

cards.title: Made in China
cards.description: Add 1 China influence in US, 1 influence in an EU country and 1 influence in any other country (non EU or US)

cards.title: Middle East
cards.description: 2/2/2, +1VP per conflictive country,

cards.title: Muammar Gaddafi
cards.description: Gain 1 influence in Libya. Put this card in play. Libya becomes an oil production country while this card is in play. Destabilization ops cannot be played on Libya.

cards.title: Neocolonialism
cards.description: Remove up to 3 VP from West players (distributed as you choose, no more than 2VP per player). Then, each West player may add 1 influence on any country

cards.title: Neoliberalism
cards.description: Add 2 West influence in any country. Put this card in play. Each turn, remove 1 West influence from any country and place it on this card. When this card has 3 influence tokens on it, discard it.

cards.title: Northern adhesion
cards.description: Austria, Finland and Sweden are now considered EU. EU adds 1 influence on one of these countries. EU gains 1VP

cards.title: Oil crisis
cards.description: Next time that the oil punctuation card is played, the player(s) with most oil countries gains 1VP and the rest lose 1VP (all players just lose 1VP if there is a global tie)

cards.title: Oil thirst
cards.description: US next action must be a coup on an oil production country. It has an additional 1VP loss

cards.title: OPEC
cards.description: Each player gains 1VP (pre-9/11) or 2VP (post-9/11) for each of each oil country that she edges. Then (before checking for victory conditions) each player loses 2VP (pre-9/11) or 4VP (post-9/11).

cards.title: Osama bin Laden
cards.description: US removes 1 influence from any player in Middle East or Afghanistan. Put this card play. US can use influence ops in these countries. If this card is in play at 9/11, or if it is played post-9/11, US loses 1VP and removes 1 US influence from one of these countries, then discard this card.

cards.title: Party Congress
cards.description: China adds 1 influence on any country (except EU, Russia and US) or removes 1 China influence in China to add 1 influence on three countries on three different regions.

cards.title: Petrodollars
cards.description: Gain supremacy on Fiscal paradises and Sovereign funds. If another player has supremacy on any of them, remove their supremacy instead. This action ignore vetoes and aheads, as well as post 9/11 limitations.

cards.title: Rupert Murdoch
cards.description: US gains supremacy in up to two Public Opinion slots.

cards.title: Russian oligarchs
cards.description: Choose a NWO Economy slot. Discard supremacy on it, if any. Then Russia gains supremacy on it (ignore vetoes, aheads and post 9/11 limitations).

cards.title: Rwandan genocide
cards.description: West players lose 1VP each. They may lose an additional VP to add 2 influence in Congo

cards.title: Shock doctrine
cards.description: Gain supremacy on any one Economy slot, removing supremacy from any other player on it. Alternatively, you may remove supremacy on up to two slots

cards.title: Slobodan Milosevic
cards.description: Russia and China gain 1 influence in Balkan states

cards.title: Somali civil war
cards.description: Remove all influence in Somalia. Put this card in play. Until the end of the game, any player can play operations in Somalia and it is now considered linked to Saudi Arabia. Gain 1 influence in Somalia.

cards.title: South Lebanon Conflict
cards.description: US gains 1 influence in Lebanon. Put this card in play. US cannot lose influence in Lebanon while this card remains in play, and no other player can have the edge in Lebanon.

cards.title: Sudan civil wars
cards.description: Roll 1D6 and add +1 per each country adjacent to Sudan (including itself) were players of your block have the edge. Add 1 if you are a West (pre-9/11) or East (post-9/11) player. In a result of 4-6, remove 2 influence from Sudan, then gain 1 influence in Sudan.

cards.title: Tiananmen protests
cards.description: China loses 2VP. Add 1 China influence on China and remove any influence in China from any other player.

cards.title: Uncomfortable democracies
cards.description: Gain 1VP. Gain 1 influence on any of the following countries: Venezuela, Ecuador, Bolivia, Brazil, Argentina. Alternatively, you can remove up to 2 influence in Ukraine or Israel.

cards.title: Wolfowitz doctrine
cards.description: US removes up to 2 East influence from oil production or conflictive countries, then loses 1V.

cards.title: Yugoslav wars
cards.description: EU loses 1VP. EU gains enough influence to get the edge in Balkan states.

cards.title: 9/11 attacks
cards.description: US gains the edge in USA. If US already has it, gain 2 US influence in US and 1 in any two EU countries. US player loses 2VP.

cards.title: ABM Treaty withdrawal
cards.description: US loses 3VP, then China and Russia lose 1VP each (or 2 the East block)

cards.title: Abu Grahib
cards.description: US loses 2VP.

cards.title: Africa
cards.description: 1/1/2, +1VP per conflictive country, UE player loses 1VP for each country in Africa which is edged by another player and is adjacent an UE country.

cards.title: African Union
cards.description: Remove 1 West influence from an African country except Morocco. Put this card in play. From now on, no more than 1 influence can be added to African countries with a single influence operation, and coups have an additional 1VP loss.

cards.title: Al Qaeda
cards.description: Put this card in play. After US makes a coup on Middle West, Africa or Asia, the next clockwise East player may remove 1 US or EU influence from any country on the corresponding region.

cards.title: ALBA
cards.description: US loses up to 2 influence, no more than 1 influence per country on any of these countries: Venezuela, Ecuador, Bolivia, Cuba and Honduras

cards.title: Arab Spring
cards.description: Remove all West influence in Egypt or Tunisia, or up to 2 influence (no more than 1 per country) in Morocco, Saudi Arabia or Gulf States

cards.title: Asia
cards.description: 1/2/2, +1VP per conflictive country, 0/1/2, Each player loses 1VP for each country in Central-North America which is edged by another player and is adjacent to one player’s superpower countries.

cards.title: Austerity plans
cards.description: EU loses 2VP, then US may place 1 influence on an EU country and Europe may place 1 influence on up to 2 EU countries.

cards.title: BRICS
cards.description: Each player gains 1VP for each one of the following countries where the player has the edge in: Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. Then each player loses 2VP.

cards.title: Central-North America
cards.description: 0/1/2, +1VP per conflictive country, Each player loses 1VP for each country in Central-North America which is edged by another player and is adjacent to one player’s superpower countries.

cards.title: Climate change
cards.description: All players lose 1VP. Each player loses 1 VP for each economy or technology supremacy slot where the player has supremacy in

cards.title: Color revolution
cards.description: Remove all Russian influence in one of the following countries: Caucasus states, Ukraine, Balkan states, Stan states.

cards.title: Eastern adhesion
cards.description: Hungary and Poland are now considered EU. Gain 1 influence on one of these countries. EU gains 1VP.

cards.title: Economic rescue
cards.description: Gain up to 2 West influence in a single South American country, South Korea, Indonesia, Thailand, Philippines, Greece, Italy, or Spain-Portugal.

cards.title: FOIA
cards.description: Gain 1VP. Play the rest of the turn with an open hand, except for 1 card

cards.title: Fuck the EU
cards.description: Remove 1 US influence on Benelux, France, Germany or Italy. Add 1 US influence on Ukraine.

cards.title: Globalization
cards.description: All players, clockwise starting by the active player, can add 1 influence to any country. Then, the active player may place 1 additional influence on any country.

cards.title: Guantanamo
cards.description: US loses 1VP. Put this card in play. US player can remove this card from the game to cancel the text of a Personality card.

cards.title: Hezbollah
cards.description: Remove South Lebanon Conflict card if it is in play. Put this card in play, from now on, any operation (influence or destabilization) targeting Israel or Lebanon produces an additional 1VP loss

cards.title: Hu Jintao
cards.description: China chooses two countries where China has the edge. Remove influence from China on these countries until it has not the edge. Then add that many influence plus 1 on countries from N/C America, South America, Asia or Africa (except Russia and US), no more than 1 per country

cards.title: Hugo Chávez
cards.description: Remove 1 West influence on Venezuela. Place this card in play. US cannot place influence on Venezuela through 'gain influence' ops. Gain 1 influence in Venezuela.

cards.title: Invasion of Afghanistan
cards.description: US player loses 1VP unless 9/11 attacks are removed from the game. US player gains 1 influence in Afghanistan and 1 influence in Pakistan

cards.title: Invasion of Crimea
cards.description: Russia gains 1 influence in Ukraine, and loses 1VP. Then, if EU or US still have the edge in Ukraine, reduce their influence until they don't.

cards.title: Iraq war
cards.description: US player loses 1VP, then US player gains enough influence to gain the edge Iraq

cards.title: Julian Assange
cards.description: US loses 3VP. Then all other players lose 1VP

cards.title: Kim Jong Il
cards.description: Remove all West influence on North Korea. Put this card in play: West cannot make coups or influence North Korea. Gain 1 influence in North Korea.

cards.title: Kyoto Protocol
cards.description: Each player may remove 1 supremacy technology or economy token. If they don’t or can’t, they lose 1VP

cards.title: Libyan civil war
cards.description: Remove Gaddafi from play (if not in play, Gaddafi cannot be played by its text for the remaining of the game). The player with the edge in Libya (if any) loses 1VP and Libya is no longer an oil production country. Remove all influence in Libya. Gain 1 influence in Libya

cards.title: New START
cards.description: US and Russia may remove 1 supremacy military token to gain 1 VP

cards.title: Nord Stream 1
cards.description: EU may count Russia as an edged oil production country for oil production punctuation card (the player that edges Russia can also count it for that punctuation). Russia may add 1 influence in one EU (non UK) country.

cards.title: NWO
cards.description: Lose 2VP. Then the game ends. Can only be played in turns 6 to 8.

cards.title: PRISM
cards.description: US spies on its neighbours. US loses 1VP and 1 influence on a country where the EU has also influence.

cards.title: Second eastern adhesion
cards.description: Romania and Bulgaria are now considered EU. Gain 1 influence on one of these countries. EU gains 1 VP.

cards.title: South America
cards.description: 0/1/2, +1VP per conflictive country,

cards.title: Syrian civil war
cards.description: Remove all influence in Syria. Russia gains 1 influence in Syria and loses 1VP

cards.title: The Kirchners
cards.description: Put this card in play. Russia and China can play influence ops in Argentina or any adjacent country while this card is in play. Gain 1 influence on one of such countries.

cards.title: The mother of all wars
cards.description: Make a coup with this ops value, no VP are lost

cards.title: Viktor Yushchenko
cards.description: Russia loses 1VP and 1 influence in Ukraine.

cards.title: Vladimir Putin
cards.description: Russia gains 1 (2 if FSB is in play) influence in Russia. Put this card in play. After any player gains the edge on a country (except China) adjacent to Russia, Russia player can discard this card to attempt a coup with the same ops value than the card that provided the edge.

cards.title: War on terror
cards.description: Put this card in play. US coups on Middle East or Africa no longer produce a loss on VP.

cards.title: Conspiracy theory
cards.description: PROMO. Pick a card from another player's hand. Play it by its text switching Russia and US, China and EU, and West and East.

cards.title: Silvio Berlusconi
cards.description: PROMO. If first epoch, remove any Russia influence from Italy and gain 1VP. If second epoch, EU loses 1VP.

cards.title: Madrid bombings
cards.description: PROMO. EU player must choose to remove 1 West influence on Spain-Portugal or remove 1 EU influence on Afghanistan.
